snippet: F.B.I. investigators believe that officials with the tax-collecting agency did not break the law by giving special attention to conservative groups.
abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation concludes that Internal Revenue Service officials did not commit crimes in the unusually heavy scrutiny of conservative groups that applied for tax-exempt status.
lead_paragraph: F.B.I. investigators believe that officials with the tax-collecting agency did not break the law by giving special attention to conservative groups.

headline.main: Charges Seen as Unlikely in Scrutiny by the I.R.S.
headline.print_headline: Charges Seen as Unlikely in Scrutiny by the I.R.S.
